dublinCore.dc:title: 119 HR 2812 IH: Youth Lead Act
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Bacon (for himself, Mr. Valadao, Mr. Lawler, Mr. Fitzpatrick, Mr. LaMalfa, Ms. De La Cruz, Mr. Davis of North Carolina, Mr. Panetta, Mr. Bishop, and Mr. Sorensen) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Agriculture

form.official-title: To make grants to the Girl Scouts of the United States of America, the Boy Scouts of America, the National 4H Council, and the National FFA Organization to establish pilot projects to expand the programs carried out by the organizations in rural areas and small towns, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Youth Lead Act.
Section 410(d) of the Agricultural Research, Extension, and Education Reform Act of 1998 (7 U.S.C. 7630(d)) is amendedâ€”

paragraph.text: by striking and at the end of paragraph (1);
by striking the period at the end of paragraph (2) and inserting ; and; and
by adding at the end the following:
$5,000,000 for each of fiscal years 2026 through 2030.
